alert.note: Alert for Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 23 at 12:52PM MST until January 24 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations ranging between 6 and 10 inches south of the I-40 corridor into the Manzano Mountains and 3 to 6 inches north of the I-40 corridor into the Sandia Mountains. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Sandia and Manzano Mountains including Edgewood. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to Noon MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Visibility may be reduced below 1/2 mile at times. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes portions of I-40. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening and Tuesday morning commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.
